p.s: In the following I'm going to analyze the most important film-stylistic devices, with regards to Chris and his behaviour as Starr's boyfriend, just like his relationship with Starr.
The given sequence can be devideddivided into four parts; Chris is slowly walking towards Starr, them talking about their relationship, Chris dancing and Starr going in another room with Chris.
The scene begins with Chris walking up to Starr.
This sequence is presented in a medium shot, forcing the viewer to look aat Chris, confidently walking with his headphones.
We experience that Chris is very popular, because everybody in school seems to know him and him being very confident.
This feeling is made with the camera angle, which is slightly pointing up to him, giving us the feeling that he is indeed confident.
Also, the camera is is showing him walking in slow motion.
This is used when we see something special in movies.
Therefore, Chris seems to be an important person.
Another huge impact makes the music and the voice over.
The music describes a person with beautiful eyes and the voiceoveris describing StarrsStarr's thoughts about Chris.
Both, make Chris appear special and important to Starr.
While watching Chris in slow motion, we can also notice Starr secretelysecretly watching him.
This gives us the feeling that Chris is important to her and that she can't hide her feelings for him.
The camera is also zooming in on Starr, which is expressing the feeling of Starr enjoying seeing and thinking about him.
The first part ends with a quick dolly shot, changing the focus from Chris to Starr.
It is interesting to see that Chris and Starr stop smiling after having made eye contact.
This is because their relationship is serious and not perfect at that time.
The second part begins with a medium close up, so that we can see that Starr is turned with her back against Chris and not smiling.
We can also notice Chris behind her, putting his earphones on Starr.
The music playing is rap which can be associated with Starr's actual home and her actual self.
This gives us the feeling that Chris knows Starr very well, becausbecause it makes her smile.
The conversation is presented in a close up and over the shoulder shot, forcing us to look at their emotions.
Once again we can see the seriousness of their relationship at that time.
The third part is shown in a long shot.
This is because we shall see Chris dancing, him standing in the middle of the hallway and the people around him.
Just like in the beginning of the scene, we get presented that Chris is confident and makes Starr smile, which also mirrors that they are meant to be together even if it is hard at that time.
Finally, we can see the camera slowly zooming in on Chris.
This is made to show that Starr wants to be with him and feels embarassedembarrassed about him doing it.
Finally we see them standing together in a room, with no people except them.
The director maybe wants to express that even though their current situation is tough, they still belong together.

All in all, we get to know the personality of Chris, simply with good film-stylistic devices and experience that they both totally like one and another even if their relationship isn't perfect at that time.
